content.description: Laybacking and pockets lead to a headwall where using the left side of the arete can makes things easier. Topout to the right side of the pillar.
content.location: Left side of Best of the Rest, starting off the top of a small dirt hummock.

content.description:
Wild underclings lead to long crux moves until the angle eases. A no-hands rest lets you recover before the final headwall crux on perfect stone. 

  The first 12' of the route has less than perfect stone. Stick clipping the first bolt avoids any problems with this and keeps you off the rock at the base of the route. 

  If not for the rock at the start, along with the no-hands rest, this would be a mega classic. It still is classic.
content.location: Heads up the center of the tower formation and starts just left of the large rock at the base.

content.description: This includes a series of small walls between Los Huevos and the Retirement Wall. The climbing is quite varied and in grade and style. It gets a variety of sun and some midday shade on its left end due to tall trees near the cliff.
